spatially-resolved-dataset.label: Spatially Resolved
spatially-resolved-dataset.description: A dataset that has one or more spatial axes. This term is mainly intended for retrieval.  To annotate datasets, use a narrower term.

image.label: Image
image.description: An astronomical image with exactly two spatial axes. The image content may be complex.  For instance, an objective-prism observation would be considered a type of image, even though an extracted spectrum would be a spectrum data product.

cube.label: Cube
cube.description: A multidimensional astronomical image with 3 or more axes, e.g., a spectral image cube, a polarization cube, a full Stokes radio data cube, a time image cube.

spectral-cube.label: Spectral Cube
spectral-cube.description: A 3-dimensional astronomical image with two spatial  and one spectral axis.

time-cube.label: Time Cube
time-cube.description: A 3-dimensional astronomical image with two spatial  and one temporal axis.

polarization-cube.label: Polarization Cube
polarization-cube.description: A 3-dimensional astronomical image with two spatial  and one polarization axis.

spatial-profile.label: Spatial Profile
spatial-profile.description: An observable obtained along a one-dimensional spatial path.

polarization-resolved-dataset.label: Polarization Resolved
polarization-resolved-dataset.description: Sets of fluxes for different polarization states.  This term is mainly intended for retrieval.  To annotate datasets, use a narrower term.

spectrally-resolved-dataset.label: Spectrally Resolved
spectrally-resolved-dataset.description: A dataset that has a spectral axis. This term is mainly intended for retrieval.  To annotate datasets, use a narrower term.

spectrum.label: Spectrum
spectrum.description: Flux or magnitude as a function of a spectral coordinate.

sed.label: SED
sed.description: A spectral energy distribution, i.e., a set of calibrated fluxes over a typically wide part of the spectrum.  An SED is usually produced by combining data from multiple observations.

slit-spectrum.label: Slit Spectrum
slit-spectrum.description: Spectral measurements along a slit in space, organized as a set of successive spectra along the slit.

polarized-spectrum.label: Polarization Spectrum
polarized-spectrum.description: Fluxes or magnitudes given as a function of a spectral coordinate and a polarization state.

dynamic-spectrum.label: Dynamic Spectrum
dynamic-spectrum.description: Consecutive spectral measurements through time,organized as a sequence of successive spectra

visibility.label: Visibility
visibility.description: An interferometric radio observation given in Fourier space.

temporally-resolved-dataset.label: Temporally Resolved
temporally-resolved-dataset.description: A dataset with a time axis.  This term is mainly intended for retrieval.  To annotate datasets, use a narrower term.

event-list.label: Event List
event-list.description: A collection of observed events, such as incoming high-energy particles. A row in an event list is typically characterised by a spatial position, a time and an energy.

timeseries.label: Time Series
timeseries.description: One or a few scalar observables as a function of time.  Prefer narrower terms if there is one for your observable(s).

light-curve.label: Light Curve
light-curve.description: Flux or magnitude as a function of time

velocity-curve.label: Velocity Curve
velocity-curve.description: Radial velocities or redshifts as a function of time

measurements.label: Measurements
measurements.description: Generic tabular data not fitting any of the other terms.  For instance, a list of sources extracted from an image might be a measurement.  Because of its lack of specificity, this term should generally be avoided, and new, more precise terms should be introduced instead.
